snippet: Major League Soccer is negotiating to locate its 20th franchise in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park as its first New York City team.
abstract: Officials of Major League Soccer are negotiating to locate a 20th franchise in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park, in what would be New York City's first professional soccer team; new stadium would hold about 25,000 spectators and construction would create more than 2,000 temporary jobs and 300 permanent ones; proposed team does not yet have a name or an owner.

headline.main: Soccer Enthusiasts Hope for a Stadium and a Pro Team in Queens
headline.print_headline: Soccer Enthusiasts Hope For a Stadium in Queens

snippet: Judge Lucy Koh warned that both sides faced risks if an intellectual property suit was handed to a federal jury.
abstract: Federal District Court Judge Lucy Koh, presiding over an intellectual property dispute between Apple and Samsung Electronics, warns that both sides face risks if the suit is handed to a jury; says the chief executives of the two firms should talk again.

headline.main: Judge Urges Apple and Samsung to Settle Their Patent Dispute
headline.print_headline: Judge Urges Apple and Samsung to Settle Their Patent Dispute

snippet: If you're thinking about selling your iPhone so you can use the money to buy Apple's new smartphone when it comes out, better act fast. From now until Apple introduces the new iPhone, expected to be Sept. 12, consumers are likely to get the best p...
abstract: If you're thinking about selling your iPhone so you can use the money to buy Apple's new smartphone when it comes out, better act fast. From now until Apple introduces the new iPhone, expected to be Sept. 12, consumers are likely to get the best prices online for their old phones, according Gazelle, a Web site that buys old iPhones and other gadgets and resells them

headline.main: Selling the Old iPhone Before the Upgraders Do

snippet: Most self-published books don’t sell a lot of copies. But it’s easier than ever to try one’s luck.
abstract: Tool Kit column explores self-publishing on the Web; notes that most self-published books sell fewer than 100 or 150 copies, but it is easier than ever to try one's luck.

headline.main: The Joys and Hazards of Self-Publishing on the Web
headline.print_headline: The Joys and Hazards of Self-Publishing on the Web

snippet: Samsung’s new iPad rival, the Galaxy Note 10.1, is loaded with features, but not all are well organized or practical.
abstract: David Pogue State of the Art column observes that Samsung’s new iPad rival, the Galaxy Note 10.1, is loaded with features, but not all are well organized or practical; notes it is designed to favor horizontal use, and its stylus can be used like pen on paper or like a computer mouse.

headline.main: A Tablet Straining to Do It All
headline.print_headline: A Tablet Straining To Do It All

snippet: From now until Apple introduces the new iPhone, expected to be Sept. 12, consumers are likely to get the best prices online for their old phones.
abstract: From now until Apple introduces the new iPhone, expected to be Sept. 12, consumers are likely to get the best prices online for their old phones.

headline.main: Getting a Jump on iPhone Upgraders

snippet: In honor of Julia Child, whipping up one of her classic desserts: île flottante, floating island, a cake of soft meringue rising from a pale custard sea.
abstract: Melissa Clark A Good Appetite column presents a recipe for floating island with apricot creme anglaise in honor of Julia Child.

headline.main: On a Floating Island With Julia Child
headline.print_headline: On a Floating Island With Julia Child

snippet: The super-shock-absorbent material called non-Newtonian polymer inspires a lot of don't-try-this-at-home stunts, like getting  whacked in the head with a shovel  through a layer of the stuff.But these materials are also used in protective clothing...
abstract: Gadgetwise blog notes that Tech21 puts polymer D30 in protective cases for a variety of smartphones and some tablets and e-readers. Photo (M)ù

headline.main: Soft to Cushion a Phone, Hard When It Needs to Be

snippet: Q. Can a wireless router go bad? I have to restart mine at least once a day to restore my Internet connection. Should I just get a new one?A. The reliability and performance of a network router can degrade over time. Other factors, like out-of-dat...
abstract: Personal Tech Q&A column on fixing a deteriorating router, sorting accounts with Microsoft, and Notifications settings on the iPad, iPhone or iPod Touch. (M)ÿ

headline.main: There Is Help For an Ailing Router

snippet: Square's tie-up with  Starbucks  may be this year's most important venture capital deal.The deal not only has the potential to change the way people pay for coffee and everything else, it also shows how small innovation applied to everyday tasks m...
abstract: Steven M Davidoff Deal Professor column on Square's partnership with Starbucks for accepting mobile payments; says that while deal may be be revolutionary and a game changer, it is only the latest example of how Silicon Valley has become about process and networking more than anything else. Drawing (M)/

headline.main: In the Ordinary, Finding Silicon Valley's Next Big Thing
